definitions.definition: The condition of being free from control or restrictions.
definitions.example: The army is here, your liberty is assured.

definitions.definition: The condition of being free from imprisonment, slavery or forced labour.
definitions.example: The prisoners gained their liberty from an underground tunnel.

definitions.definition: The condition of being free to act, believe or express oneself as one chooses.
definitions.example: Everyone has the right to life, liberty and security of person.

definitions.definition: A short period when a sailor is allowed ashore.
definitions.example: We're going on a three-day liberty as soon as we dock.

definitions.definition: (often plural) A breach of social convention.
A local division of government administration in medieval England.
(game of go) an empty space next to a group of stones of the same color.
